text.__SUMMARY__:
Chamaelaucium brevifolium is a member of the family Myrtaceae endemic to Western Australia.The erect and open shrub typically grows to a height of 0.3 to 1.3 metres (1 to 4 ft). It blooms between September and November producing white flowers.Found on undulating plains in the northern Wheatbelt region of Western Australia where it grows in sandy soils over laterite.
